# isRotatedFromBase

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the view or any of its ancestors has ever had a rotation factor applied to its frame or bounds.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isRotatedFromBase: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the view or any of its ancestors has had its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/frameRotation] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/boundsRotation] properties modified at any time. The value is still [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the rotation factor is changed to a nonzero value and then back to 0.

Use this information to optimize drawing and coordinate calculation. Do not use it to reflect the exact state of the view’s coordinate system.

## Related Documentation

- **frameRotation**: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s frame rectangle relative to its superview’s coordinate system.
- **boundsRotation**: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s bounds rectangle relative to its frame rectangle.

## Examining Coordinate System Modifications

- **isFlipped**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view uses a flipped coordinate system.
- **isRotatedOrScaledFromBase**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view or any of its ancestors has ever had a rotation factor applied to its frame or bounds, or has been scaled from the window’s base coordinate system.
